Description: Ostracon, fragment from the body of a red-brown pottery ribbed vessel, exterior covered with a brown-coloured slip and with remains of eight lines of red/brown Coptic text writtenin black ink, now very faded, containing a list of vessels.
Bibliographic references: Crum & Bell 1922 / Wadi Sarga: Coptic and Greek texts (p.119)
Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (87626) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/87626)
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: O.Sarga 136 (text edition abbreviation according to Oates et al 2001)
